abstract.p: Cordiant Communications Group in London and Publicis Groupe SA in Paris agree to discuss forming giant media company (S)

block.p: The Cordiant Communications Group in London and the Publicis Groupe S.A. in Paris have agreed to discuss forming a giant media company.

The Cordiant Communications Group in London and the Publicis Groupe S.A. in Paris have agreed to discuss forming a giant media company.

Maurice Levy, the chairman and chief executive of Publicis, confirmed a report of the negotiations that appeared in the daily fax edition of Advertising Age, adding, ''We hope to have a final agreement by the end of the year.''

The talks began after Publicis completed its takeover last week of Saatchi & Saatchi, which owned 50 percent of Zenith Media, a leading media services agency. Cordiant owns the other half. The new agency company could place under one roof Zenith and Optimedia International, the large media services agency Publicis owns.
Michael Bungey, Cordiant's chief executive, was traveling yesterday, his staff said, and could not be reached for comment.
